bibl.title: Standard Koine Greek in Third Century BC Papyri.

series.title: American Studies in Papyrology. Special Edition

bibl.note: The Idea of Standard Koine Greek in the Papyri: 1. The idea of "bad" Greek in third century BC documents; - The idea of "good" Greek in third century BC documents. - Sentence-Connective Particles and the Proposed "Control". [The "control" is a set of texts built around the documents written in the name of Apollonios the finance minister.] - Some Conclusions.

bibl.title: Adam HYATT (Assistant Editor), Proceedings of the 25th International Congress of Papyrology. Ann Arbor, July 29 - August 4, 2007

bibl.seg: EVANS T.V., Standard Koine Greek in Third Century BC Papyri.

Traianos GAGOS (Editor), Adam HYATT (Assistant Editor), Proceedings of the 25th International Congress of Papyrology. Ann Arbor, July 29 - August 4, 2007 = American Studies in Papyrology. Special Edition (Ann Arbor, 2010) pp. 197-205.

The Idea of Standard Koine Greek in the Papyri: 1. The idea of "bad" Greek in third century BC documents; - The idea of "good" Greek in third century BC documents. - Sentence-Connective Particles and the Proposed "Control". [The "control" is a set of texts built around the documents written in the name of Apollonios the finance minister.] - Some Conclusions.
